name: descriptively
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that describes something, especially in a detailed, interesting way: One of the real highlights in the Botanic Gardens is the descriptively named bee orchid. The six short stories are descriptively compelling.
language, social science
  specialized If you study something descriptively, your study is based on saying what your subject is really like, rather than developing theories about it. : We descriptively analyzed the data. This model fails to provide a descriptively adequate account of the facts.
More examplesFewer examplesLessons on character, setting, and dialogue help students to write descriptively. The problem, descriptively called "purple spot", is caused by poor soil conditions. Data are presented descriptively and differences compared.
